category: help-others-quotes, help-quotes, humility-quotes, intelligence-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, life-lessons-quotes, life-quotations, life-quotes, life-quotes-and-sayings, modesty-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: Seek to be the smartest in a room, not the loudest.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: advice-for-daily-living, advice-quotes, intelligence-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, life-lessons-quotes, silence-quotes, smart-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wisest-people

quote: An open heart has greater power than a clenched fist.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: anger-quotes, animosity-quotes, forgiveness-quotes, goodness-quotes, grudge-quotes, hate-quotes, heart-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, love-quotes, patience-quotes, power-quotes, revenge-quotes, spiritual-quotes, spirituality-quotes, unforgiveness, wisdom-quotes

quote: Valid questions are better than invalid assumptions.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: assumptions-quote, fact-quotes, opinion-quotes, questions-quotes, truth-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Don't judge a lion by its swimming abilities.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: ability-and-attitude, ability-quotes, judge-quotes, judgement-quotes, judgemental-quotes, leader-quotes, leadership-quotes, lion-quotes, mentoring-quotes, skill-quotes, talent-quotes, teaching-quotes, training-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: It is in vain to wipe away tears in the rain.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: grief-quotes, sadness-quotes, sorrows, tears-quotes, unhappy-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: God created sages because He wanted to leave the light on in the universe.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: enlightenment-quotes, god-quotes, guru-quotes, inner-light-quotes, light-quotes, make-the-world-a-better-place, philosophy-quotes, philospher-quotes, sage-quotes, shine-quotes, shine-your-light-quotes, universe-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-man-quotes, wise-person-quotes, wise-words-quotes

quote: You have no power over your past,but you do over your present.You have no power over your history,but you do over your future.You have no power over your fortune,but you do over your actions.You have no power over your reputation,but you do over your character.You have no power over destiny,but you do over yourself.You have no power over anyone,but you do over your world.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lessons-quotes, life-quotes, power-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, words-of-wisdom

quote: Don't make excuses for your mistakes.Don't try to please your enemies.Don't run from your responsibilities.Don't force your opinions on others.Don't complain about things you can change.Don't compare yourself to anyone.Don't let undeserving people into your life.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: character-quotes, conduct-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, life-lessons-quotes, life-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: Light enters a broken vessel more easily than an intact one.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: adversity-quotes, broken-heart-quotes, broken-hearted-quotes, inner-light-quotes, life-quotes, light-quotes, santification-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: Anger slowly.Forgive quickly.Trust cautiously.Love easily.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: anger-quotes, forgive-quotes, life-lessons-quotes, life-quotes, love-quotes, trust-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: Smiling through confusion is courage.Smiling through tears is strength.Smiling through pain is power.Smiling through tragedy is greatness.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: courage-quotes, greatness-quotes, inspirational-quotes, life-lessons-quotes, life-quotes, power-quotes, strength-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: Dream more.Learn more.Work more.Become more.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: dream-quotes, greatness-quotes, learning-quotes, life-lessons, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, words-of-wisdom, work-quotes

quote: The best opportunities sometimes have the worst appearances.The poorest people sometimes have the richest minds.The shallowest people sometimes have the deepest pockets.The quietest people sometimes have the wildest hearts.The meekest people sometimes have the greatest power.The calmest people sometimes have the uneasiest souls.The humblest people sometimes have the biggest accomplishments.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lesson-quotes, life-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: You cannot lose if you have learned one new lesson.You cannot lose if you have helped one new person.You cannot lose if you have overcome one new obstacle.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: help-quotes, learning-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, overcome-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: A spider is slow, but its web catches the fastest flies.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: cunning-quotes, nature-quotes, shrewdness, skill-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: You have the world at your feet if you have wisdom in your mind.You have the world in your hands if you have joy in your heart.You have the world in your bosom if you have love in your soul.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: greatness-quotes, joy-quotes, love-quotes, spiritual-quotes, transcendence-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A clean pond is more useful than a dirty ocean.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: environmentalism-quotes, nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: You cannot catch a whale and a fish with the same bait.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: fish-quotes, nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: A strong ant is better than a weak lion.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: lion-quotes, nature-quotes, strength-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: It is at the edge of intelligence that wisdom awaits.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: intelligence-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-words-quotes

quote: A cowardly warrior is like a toothless lion.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: cowardice-quotes, fear-quotes, lion-quotes, warrior-qoutes, wisdom-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: The eye, though small, sees remarkable things.The ear, though small, hears remarkable things.The hand, though small, carries remarkable things.The foot, though small, transports remarkable things.The tongue, though small, utters remarkable things.The mind, though small, perceives remarkable things.The heart, though small, contains remarkable things.The soul, though small, experiences remarkable things.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words

quote: Clenched fists are not open to receive blessings.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: anger-quotes, blessing-quotes, enmity-quotes, grudge-quotes, hate-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-words-quotes

quote: A lion is only dangerous if it has teeth.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: danger-quotes, lion-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: You cannot till this year’s land using last year’s sun.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: success-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: A toothless wolf is less dangerous than a fanged insect.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words-quotes

quote: Read when you can.Teach when you ought.Learn when you must.Apply when you should.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: knowledge-quotes, learn-quotes, read-quotes, teaching-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Think twice as much as others.Study twice as much as others.Work twice as much as others.Give twice as much as others.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: charity-quotes, give-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, study-quotes, think-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-words-quotes, work-quotes

quote: Knowledge makes you strong,understanding makes you formidable,wisdom makes you powerful,and love makes you invincible.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: knowledge-quotes, love-quotes, understanding-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: You have not lost if you have learned one new lesson.You have not lost if you have helped one new person.You have not lost if you have overcome one new obstacle.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: enlightenment-quotes, help-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, obstacles-quotes, overcomer-quotes, winner-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Listen until you're the smartest.Learn until you're the wisest.Live until you're the merriest.Love until you're the kindest.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: learn-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, listen-quotes, live-quotes, love-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-words-quotes

quote: Don't speak thoughtlessly.Don't worry unnecessarily.Don't work half-heartedly.Don't spend recklessly.Don't give begrudgingly.Don't act self-centeredly.Don't live short-sightedly.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lessons-quotes, life-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-words-quotes

quote: Don't resist change if it is to your advantage.Don't ruin a good opportunity fixating on a bad one.Don't burn down bridges you will need to cross tomorrow.Don't expect other people to solve your problems.Don't let what's behind you dictate what's ahead of you.Don't lose sleep over anyone who doesn't lose sleep over you.Don’t let life's small arrows wound your big soul.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lesson-quotes, life-quotes, sage-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-words-quotes

quote: The intelligent are candles,the virtuous are torches,the wise are lamps,and the enlightened are stars.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: enlightenment-quotes, intelligence-quotes, virtue-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: He who walks with the wise goes farther than he who runs with fools.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: fool-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: Don't take life for granted.Don't compare yourself to others.Don't run from your problems.Don't entertain negative people.Don't abuse your friendships.Don't hold onto the past.Don't throw away opportunities.Don't blame others for your failures.Don't quarrel over small issues.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lessons-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: What is in great demand, but scarce, is expensive, but even when wisdom is not in demand it is priceless.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: Action is king, but wisdom is queen.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: action-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: The hidden hand of contentment is in the rewards of the gratified. The hidden hand of bliss is in the rewards of the tranquil. The hidden hand of happiness is in the rewards of the elated. The hidden hand of joy is in the rewards of the jubilant.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: bliss-quotes, contentment-quotes, happiness-quotes, joy-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Greed is the seed of corruptionas much as virtue is the seed of justice.Wisdom is the seed of successas much as vice is the seed of destruction.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: corruption-quotes, greed-quotes, justice-quotes, vice-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: If you debate the wise,no matter how poor,they will hearken to wisdom.If you debate the foolish,no matter how rich,they will mock wisdom.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: fool-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-person-quotes

quote: Don't wait for wisdom to come and rescue you, seek it daily.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: Ancient wisdom is a present blessing.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: blessing-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Arm yourself with wisdom,arm yourself with knowledge;folly is a fierce lion roaming the streets.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: folly-quotes, knowledge-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Faith is receiving a blessing before you have seen it.Wisdom is taking care of the blessing once you have received it.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: faith-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: One secret to wisdom:think more, speak less.If you let your words be few,your troubles will not be many.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: He who despises a poor man’s wisdom has turned away great riches.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: I would rather be average and wise than be extraordinary and imprudent.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: Wisdom’s slaves are better than folly’s kings.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: folly-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: You can see a person without using your eyes,hear a person without using your ears,carry a person without using your hands,speak to a person without using your mouth,and move a person without using your feet.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: kindness-quotes, love-quotes, spiritual-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: You have beautiful ears if you listen to the plight of others,beautiful hands if you carry the burdens of others,beautiful eyes if you look out for others,beautiful feet if you visit others,a beautiful tongue if you encourage others,a beautiful mind if you enlighten others,a beautiful heart if you comfort others,and a beautiful soul if you love others.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: inner-beauty-quotes, kindness-quotes, love-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: We talk too much about love,but spend little time practising it.We debate too much about love,but spend little time utilizing it.We sermonize too much about love,but spend little time performing it.We write too much about love,but spend little time exercising it.We read too much about love,but spend little time implementing it.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: love-quotes, spiritual-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Acquaintances are numerous. Friends are few. Enemies many.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: friendship-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: Folly plots a fool's death from the moment they become friends. Wisdom bestows blessings upon a wise man from the moment they wed.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: folly-quotes, fool-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-man-quotes

quote: Understanding is important for studying,knowledge is important for teaching,and wisdom is important for living.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: knowledge-quotes, understanding-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Little things matter. Even a small tear wets the face.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Understanding is to knowledge what the flesh is to the body. Insight is to wisdom what life is to the soul.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: insight-quotes, understanding-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: It is wise to read some books, and wise to throw away some.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: book-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Knowledge is air to the wise.Wisdom is poison to a fool.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: knowledge-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Folly and evil are twins;the devil is their father,and wisdom is their enemy.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: devil-quotes, evil-quotes, folly-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Folly, like its consequences, is dreadful.Wisdom, like its rewards, is great.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: folly-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Knowledge comes naturally with studying, and with God's touch, instantly. Wisdom comes naturally with age, and with God's touch, immediately.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: god-quotes, knowledge-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: You can't hide from wisdom, it's everywhere;you won't find it in everyone, it's too rare.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: Seek God, but you will not find Him with your eyes;you will find Him with your heart. Listen to the wise, but you will not hear them with your ears;you will hear them with your heart.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: god-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Be good to those who are good,and just to those who are not;this is true wisdom.Do good unto others,not expecting them to do good unto you.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: goodness-quotes, justice-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Wisdom is simple but profound.Folly, even when complex, is stupid.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: folly-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: One learns wisdom from sorrow, but pleasure is one of the fruits of wisdom.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: pleasure-quotes, sorrow-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: To one full of love:a stranger is his brother,a stranger is his sister,a stranger is his mother,a stranger is his father.To one full of self:a stranger is a nuisance,a stranger is an intruder,a stranger is an adversary,a stranger is a stranger.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: kindness-quotes, love-quotes, spiritual-quotes, strangers-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: So much can be done,even when little is said.So little can be done,even when much is spoken.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Never make a promise you can't keep.Never look down on a person you can't help.Never solicit a question you can't answer.Never judge a person you don't understand.Never condemn a person you don't know.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lesson-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Not all of us were meant to teach,but all of us were meant to learn.Not all of us were meant to lead,but all of us were meant to serve.Not all of us were meant to be rich,but all of us were meant to be charitable.Not all of us were meant to be famous,but all of us were meant to be upright.Not all of us were meant to be mighty,but all of us were meant to persevere.Not all of us were meant to be extraordinary,but all of us were meant to prevail.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lessons-quotes, life-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: To know is to memorize.To understand is to utilize.The accumulation of knowledge is learnedness.The accumulation of wisdom is experience.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: experience-quotes, knowledge-quotes, learning-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Less fear, more courage.Less doubt, more faith.Less talking, more action.Less ignorance, more knowledge.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lessons-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: Strength accomplishes sizable things.Wisdom accomplishes incredible things.Faith accomplishes remarkable things.Love accomplishes unbelievable things.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: love-quotes, success-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Wisdom is more faithful than a woman,and knowledge is more faithful than a friend.Folly is more oppressive than a tyrant,and evil more overwhelming than fury.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: evil-quotes, knowledge-quotes, spiritual-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A living fool is worth less than a dead hero.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: fool-quotes, hero-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A wise man's sorrow is better than a fool's happiness.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: happiness-quotes, sorrow-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-man-quotes

quote: The upright are richer in deeds than the wealthy are in gold.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: rich-quotes, virtue-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A wise man is closer to God than a fool will ever be to himself.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: fool-quotes, god-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-man-quotes

quote: Wisdom is better than flattery, even if bitter in your ears.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: flattery-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: Wisdom is a reliable companion.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: friend-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Liars corrupt knowledge,and fools pervert wisdom,but the wise hallow both.Knowledge holds the truth.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: knowledge-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-man-quotes

quote: What the wise see eyes closed is greater than what the ignorant see both eyes open.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: ignorance-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-man-quotes

quote: It is better to lose friends than to lose your reputation, and better to lose riches than to lose your integrity.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: reputation-quotes, virtue-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: When you strike the shepherd you strike the sheep.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: leadership-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: Scholars love knowledge.Philosophers love wisdom.The most knowledgeable become professors.The most wise become sages.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: knowledge-quotes, philosopher-quotes, sage-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Where there is wisdom there is life,and where there is evil there is death.Folly is your enemy and so are fools;wisdom is your friend and so are the wise.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: evil-quotes, folly-quotes, life-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: It's easier to conceal wisdom than folly.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: folly-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Wisdom is a teacher,God is its professor.The wise are His students,life is His rod,and eternal life is our reward.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: god-quotes, life-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: To forsake wisdom is to seek folly,to seek folly is to seek evil,to seek evil is to be in the arms of the devil,and to be in the arms of the devil is be in the arms of death.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: death-quotes, devil-quotes, folly-quotes, life-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Wisdom is the greatest speaker in history;nature, second.Folly is the worst speaker in history;fools, second.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: folly-quotes, fools-quotes, nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Light is formless, but pierces the eyes.Wisdom is formless, but pierces the mind.Faith is formless, but pierces the heart.Love is formless, but pierces the soul.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: The wolf pounces on the sheep when the shepherd strays.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Don’t build a cabin near a termite colony.Don’t rear rabbits near wolves.Don’t attack a cub in front of its mother.Don’t stone a bird you want to catch.Don’t pick a flower before it blooms.Don’t pick fruit before it sweetens.Don’t count game you have not caught.Don’t hunt with a blunt spear.Don’t fish in poisoned waters.Don’t close your eyes near a predator.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Water wrestles great opponents,but has no hands,and tramples great rivals,but has no feet.It slips through our fingers,but can swallow entire towns.Wind also slips through our fingers,but can swallow entire cities.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Nurture a tree today, and it will provide you fruit tomorrow.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: invest-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A sharp stick is better than a blunt sword.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: skill-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: He who is happy in his hut is better than he who is miserable in his palace.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: happy-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A pond with one fish is better than an ocean with none.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: A sage’s mind is greater than a warrior’s sword.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: sage-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A diligent ant is more useful than a lazy cow.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: diligence-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: If you light a fire, you cannot conceal the smoke.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Feeding a lion will not prevent it from feeding on you.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: A cup of wisdom is more valuable than an ocean of intelligence.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: intelligence-quote, wisdom-quotes

quote: Fish rule the waters,but can be caught using worms.Birds rule the air,but can be caught using grain.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Wind has no home in the world,and therefore wanders everywhere.Light has no home in the universe,and therefore returns to God.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: A good question is the shortcut to a good answer.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes

quote: In trees, monkeys rule;on land, lions rule;in the sky, eagles rule;in the waters, whales rule.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: One who is lost cannot show others the way.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: The blind cannot see light,but can feel its warmth.The deaf cannot hear sound,but are aware of its power.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Raising donkeys in the midst of horses will not make them sprinters.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: A lion does not take orders from sheep.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: leadership-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Speak well of the sun, but know that it can harm you;when enraged, it is pitiless. Speak well of the ocean, but know that it can injure you; when angry, it is merciless. Speak well of the wind, but know that it can wound you; when provoked, it is ruthless.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: nature-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: As light nourishes plants, wisdom nourishes sages.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: sage-quotes, wisdom-quotes

quote: Three quarters of faith is boldness.Three quarters of wisdom is intelligence.Three quarters of love is kindness.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: The deaf cannot hear wind,but can feel its touch.The blind cannot see the sun,but can feel its warmth.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: Bait, no matter how big, is useless if fish don’t want it.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes, wise-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Wisdom is finer than pearls.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: Do good.Spread love.Embrace all.Hurt none.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
category: life-lessons-quotes, wisdom-quotes, wise-sayings

quote: Love is free, but priceless.Wisdom is precious, but costless.Faith is gentle, but fearless.Joy is scarce, but limitless.Truth is simple, but matchless.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: You don’t stop planting corn because weeds are going to grow beside it.
